definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This article presents professor Cai Gan's experience in the treatment of senile habitual constipation.
sentences.chinese: 介绍蔡淦教授治疗老年习惯性便秘的经验。

sentences.english: He was routinely likened to Cromwell.
sentences.chinese: 人们习惯性地把他与克伦威尔作比。

sentences.english: Customarily, I spent the weekends at my aunt Badri's.
sentences.chinese: 我还总是习惯性的在巴德丽姨妈家过周末。

sentences.english: Symbols are signs that refer to the object by a convention.
sentences.chinese: 标志是一种人们习惯性指代某种事物的符号。

sentences.english: The other arose out of the habitual activity of the park’s users.
sentences.chinese: 另一组是由逛公园的人们的习惯性活动踩踏出来的。

sentences.english: That smile is more likely to become a habitual smile, " noted Goodstein."
sentences.chinese: 那这种笑脸将更有可能成为一种习惯性的笑”。

sentences.english: His boss discharged him for habitual absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 他的老板因他习惯性旷工而解雇了他。

sentences.english: We are accustomed to thinking of insurance as a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经习惯性地认为保险是个好东西。

sentences.english: During the Han Dynasty, the stone tablet sum which was habitually called the sum of seal script was mostly written with the seal script.
sentences.chinese: 两汉时期的碑额多用篆书书写，习惯性的被称为篆额。

sentences.english: So we are conditioned to claim that we don't trust people much.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们习惯性地声称自己不大信任他人。

sentences.english: Finally, many people end up habitually using payday loans much to their detriment.
sentences.chinese: 最后，许多人习惯性地用发薪日贷款来付款。

sentences.english: Every time, wherever he goes, he is used to turning right.
sentences.chinese: 每次出门，不管去哪里，总是习惯性的先向右走。

sentences.english: The present invention relates to a medicament for treating recurrent spontaneous abortion.
sentences.chinese: 此项发明系治疗习惯性自然流产之医学方法。

sentences.english: Automatic, habitual reactions lead us and others into blind alleys.
sentences.chinese: 机械的，习惯性的反应会将我们带入一个狭窄的盲区。

sentences.english: You’ll probably habitually want to fill the plate.
sentences.chinese: 你肯定会想要习惯性的望餐盘里加餐。

sentences.english: Diamondback moth expressed habituation to and induced preference for non-host originated repellents.
sentences.chinese: 小菜蛾可对驱避素产生习惯性反应和诱导嗜好性。

definition: habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
